In October, Sergio Marchionne ignited controversy when he said that Fiat would be better off if it eliminated Italy. Trade unions and politicians accused him of "blackmail" in pushing through a tough deal on working conditions at Fiat's flagship Mirafiori plant in Turin to save the factory from closure. in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks

2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and the Chrysler Town& Country. Chrysler is debating the future of its minivans even as it starts making the 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country this week. heart attacks. "A Barbara Walters Special: A Matter of Life and Death"( 9 p.m., ABC) includes interviews with celebrities and notables about their experiences with open heart surgery. Robin Williams calls this group the brotherhood of the cracked chest club. Interviews with Robin Williams , Bill Clinton , David Letterman , Regis Philbin and Charlie Rose reveal very different men and their paths to near total heart disease and recovery. The side effects are often as emotionally draining as physically debilitating.

now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured." According to Eric Schmidt , the three had been "equally" involved in making decisions over the past decade.
